MsgPassingControl

public MsgPassingControl()
Method Detail

initTimeControl

public int initTimeControl(java.lang.String nodeId)
Allow adversary to specify the time of initiation of a given node ID Note: A returning time MUST be more than a current time, otherwise a current time will be returned

arrivalControl

public abstract BlockFlag arrivalControl(IMessage msg,
                                         java.lang.String edgeId,
                                         java.lang.String nodeId)
Allow adversary to control and manipulate actions of a node before a message arrives at the node. Also allows the adversary to override any blocking/unblocking that may occur to the message at the node Note: It is adversary duty to make sure any blocked message will be unblocked

Parameters:
msg - A message that is arriving
edgeId - An ID of a link that message is traveling
nodeId - An ID of a destination node
Returns:
BlockFlag.PASS if this message must be received now, BlockFlag.BLOCK if the message has to be blocked, BlockFlag.DEFAULT no overriding

arrivalTimeControl

public int arrivalTimeControl(IMessage msg,
                              java.lang.String edgeId,
                              java.lang.String nodeId)
A default implementation: Allows adversary to configure an arrival time for message when the message entering the edge Note: A returning time MUST be more than a current time, otherwise a current time + 1 will be returned.

Parameters:
msg - A message that is entering
edgeId - An ID of a link message is using
nodeId - An ID of a destination node
Returns:
A simulation time that message will be arrived at the node

dropControl

public boolean dropControl(IMessage msg,
                           java.lang.String edgeId,
                           java.lang.String nodeId)
Allow adversary to configure the lost of message that will traveling on an edge to a node. This drop will be determined right after the message is created

Parameters:
msg - A message
edgeId - An ID of a link that message is traveling through
nodeId - An ID of a destination node of the message
Returns:
True if the message will be lost before a node receive, otherwise false

blockMsg

public final void blockMsg(java.lang.String msgLable,
                           java.lang.String incomingPort,
                           java.lang.String nodeId)
Allow adversary to block any message that has a given message label at a given port at a given node

Parameters:
msgLable - A message label that want to block
incomingPort - A port that want to block
nodeId - An ID of a node that do the blocking

unblockMsg

public final void unblockMsg(java.lang.String msgLabel,
                             java.lang.String incomingPort,
                             java.lang.String nodeId)
Allow adversary to unblock a port with a given message label at a node. All messages with the label that has been blocked will be released

Parameters:
msgLable - A message label that want to unblock
incomingPort - A port that want to unblock
nodeId - An ID of a node that wants to unblock

isMsgBlocked

public final boolean isMsgBlocked(java.lang.String msgLabel,
                                  java.lang.String incomingPort,
                                  java.lang.String nodeId)
Check whether a given message label specifically is blocked at a given port of a node

Parameters:
msgLabel - A message label
incomingPort - An incoming port of the node
nodeId - An ID of a node that is checking
Returns:
True if the port exists and it blocks every incoming message with a given label, otherwise false

getTravelingMsg

public final java.util.Map<IMessage,java.lang.Integer> getTravelingMsg(java.lang.String edgeId,
                                                                       java.lang.String nodeId)
Get a list of messages(with expected arrival time) currently in a link and heading to a given destination node

Parameters:
edgeId - An ID of a link
nodeId - An ID of a destination node
Returns:
a list of message with expected arrival time if exist, otherwise empty list is returned
